DOC.brief_title: Quetiapine Delirium Prophylaxis High-risk Critically Ill Patients
DOC.detailed_description: Objective : To evaluate efficacy schedule quetiapine delirium prophylaxis critically ill , trauma/surgical patient identify high-risk delirium utilizing validate prediction model . Design : Prospective , open-label , single-center study . Setting : Trauma/surgical intensive care unit academic medical center . Patients : Eighty two adult trauma/surgical patient admit intensive care unit high-risk development delirium ( PRE-DELIRIC Score ≥50 % , past medical history dementia , past medical history alcohol misuse , past medical history drug abuse ) . Interventions : Patients randomize unit location receive pharmacologic prophylaxis delirium ( quetiapine 12.5 mg every 12 hour ) pharmacologic prophylaxis delirium within forty-eight hour admission intensive care unit . Measurements : The primary end point incidence delirium admission intensive care unit ( ICU ) . Secondary end point include time onset delirium , ICU hospital length stay , ICU hospital mortality , duration mechanical ventilation , adverse event . Delirium assess use confusion assessment method intensive care unit .
